title: Unpacking Human-AI interactions: From interaction primitives to a design space. (arXiv:2401.05115v1 [cs.HC])
abstract: This paper aims to develop a semi-formal design space for Human-AI interactions, by building a set of interaction primitives which specify the communication between users and AI systems during their interaction. We show how these primitives can be combined into a set of interaction patterns which can provide an abstract specification for exchanging messages between humans and AI/ML models to carry out purposeful interactions. The motivation behind this is twofold: firstly, to provide a compact generalisation of existing practices, that highlights the similarities and differences between systems in terms of their interaction behaviours; and secondly, to support the creation of new systems, in particular by opening the space of possibilities for interactions with models. translated_title: 揭示人机交互：从交互原则到设计空间
translated_abstract: 本文旨在通过构建一组交互原则，为人机交互开发一个半正式的设计空间，以指定用户与AI系统在交互过程中的通信方式。我们展示了这些原则如何组合成一组交互模式，为人类和AI/ML模型之间的信息交换提供抽象规范，以进行有目的的交互。这样做的动机有两个方面：首先，提供对现有实践的简洁概括，突出了系统在交互行为方面的相似性和差异性；其次，支持新系统的创建，特别是通过为与模型的交互打开可能性空间。我们对与HAI交互设计和实施相关的框架，指南和分类方法进行了简要的文献回顾，包括人机协同，可解释的AI以及混合智能。
tldr: 本文开发了一个半正式的设计空间，利用一组交互原则，为人机交互提供抽象规范，支持目的性交互，并简洁概括了现有实践的相似性和差异性。它还为新系统的创建提供了可能性空间。
en_tdlr: This paper develops a semi-formal design space for Human-AI interactions, providing an abstract specification for purposeful interactions using a set of interaction primitives, and summarizing the similarities and differences between existing practices. It also opens up possibilities for the creation of new systems.
